In addition, you can force a particular plug-in to perform a complete data-synchronization by resetting its date of last sync:

data.value: will not send out any messages.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_AllowUserControlNotes
data.value: If enabled, users will be given the option to deny receiving emails from the system.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_AllowUsersControl
data.value: Allow Users Control of Receiving Emails?

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_FromAddressNotes
data.value: The address that emails will be sent from. Replies to this address will not be monitored.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_MailHostNotes
data.value: The SMTP host name of your mail server.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_MailServerIntro
data.value: Please leave all the following fields empty if you want to use the default IIS SMTP Virtual Server:

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_PasswordNotes
data.value: If your SMTP server requires authentication, this is your password.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_PortNumberNotes
data.value: The SMTP port number to use. Leave blank to use the default of 25.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_ReplyToAddressNotes
data.value: The Reply-To field that emails sent will contain. Blank will leave header field blank in messages.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_SendInHtmlNotes
data.value: If enabled, emails will be sent out in HTML. Otherwise, plain text.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_String2
data.value: will use the default IIS SMTP Virtual Server to send outgoing email notifications to users in the system. However, it can also be configured to send emails through an external SMTP server directly.

data.name: Admin_EmailConfiguration_String3
data.value: This page allows you to change these mail server settings:

data.name: Admin_GraphDetails_QueryLegend
data.value: You need to enter the ESQL command for retrieving the graph data. You can use the special tokens ${ProjectId} and ${ProjectGroupId} to limit the query to a specific product or program. The first column will be the X-Axis of the graph (and can be any data type). The other columns make up the different data series, and must be numeric types.

data.name: ProjectDetails_ChangingTemplateSideEffects
data.value: Changing the template associated with a product will result in its custom properties, workflows, artifact types, prioirities and statuses to change to those of the new template. The system will remove any artifact values that don't match the new product template.

data.name: Admin_ProjectDetails_BasedOnNotes
data.value: Basing the product on an existing one will copy across its membership, settings and customizations. You can either use the same product template, or copy the settings to a new template.

data.name: Admin_ProjectDetails_TemplateNotes2
data.value: Choose an existing template if you want the new product to have the custom properties, artifact fields, workflows, and notifications as the chosen template.

data.name: GeneralSettings_UseTaraVaultForSourceCodeNotes

data.name: Admin_UserDetails_LinkToLdap_Summary
data.value: To link the user's account to your LDAP server, you will need to enter the user's full LDAP Distinguished Name (DN). Once the change is made, the user will login with the same username, but with their LDAP password instead.

data.name: Admin_UserDetails_LinkToLdap_Title
data.value: Link User Account to LDAP Server

data.name: SystemInfo_DeleteSampleDataInfo
data.value: The original sample data is still installed on this system. Click the button below to delete this information.

data.name: UserProfile_RssTokenApiKeyReminder
data.value: Please hit SAVE after generating a new key

data.name: ProjectGroupHome_ActiveReleasesOnlySettingTooltip
data.value: Determines if this widget will only include the data from active releases in the products that are part of this program, or from all releases.

data.name: ProjectGroupHome_IncludeActiveReleasesSettingTooltip
data.value: Should we display the builds for the active releases as well as the latest for the product.

data.name: Admin_PlanningOptions_ReqPlanUsingPointsNotes1
data.value: With this setting enabled, you estimate a requirement using points. The hours are not displayed on the detail page for requirements. The effort for incidents, tasks and test cases is not used. You specify the planned # points per release/sprint. The planning board shows the number of points planned, utilized and remaining.

data.name: Admin_PlanningOptions_ReqPlanUsingPointsNotes2
data.value: With this setting disabled, you estimate a requirement using points. It is displayed in hours using a velocity conversion factor. You estimate incidents, tasks and test cases in hours directly. You specify the time available in a release/sprint. The planning board shows the number of hours planned, utilized and remaining.

data.name: Admin_PlanningOptions_KanbanWipIntro
data.value: Please enter the % Work in Progress (WIP) limits for each requirement status (blank means no limit), as well as the multiplier that specifies how many requirements should be active in the entire release/iteration based on the # resources allocated to the specific release/sprint:

data.name: Admin_PlanningOptions_KanbanWipNotes
data.value: For example, if you have a sprint with 5 people, you can set the WIP multiplier to be 2x the number of people. That will allow 10 requirements to be active in the sprint. You can then specify that Developed and Tested both allow 50% of the WIP items. That means that both Developed and Tested will allow upto 5 items in the Kanban board.

data.name: Admin_TestingSettings_DisableBlocked
data.value: Disable users from marking a test step as BLOCKED

data.name: Admin_TestingSettings_DisableCaution
data.value: Disable users from marking a test step as CAUTION

data.name: Admin_TestingSettings_DisableNA
data.value: Disable users from marking a test step as N/A

data.name: Admin_TestingSettings_DisablePassAll
data.value: Disable users from PASSING ALL test steps at once

data.name: Admin_TestingSettings_ActualResultAlways
data.value: User must ALWAYS enter an actual result for Test Steps

data.name: Admin_TestingSettings_AllowTasks
data.value: Users can create Tasks during execution (including exploratory testing)

data.name: Admin_TestingSettings_ExecuteSetsOnlyNotes
data.value: Users will not be able to execute Test Cases. They will only be able to execute Test Sets

data.name: Admin_TestingSettings_RequireIncident
data.value: Every test step that does not pass must have an Incident

data.name: TestCaseExecution_IncidentRequired
data.value: WARNING! You need to add an Incident to this Test Step to continue

data.name: GeneralSettings_VersionControlCacheRetentionNotesMinutes
data.value: The number of minutes that the cache of source code commits is kept before being automatically refreshed.

data.name: Admin_RoleDetails_SourceCodeExplanation
data.value: Source code permissions control this role's access to all source code pages, including the source code files and commits.

data.name: Register_PasswordMinLengthAndNonAlphaChars
data.value: Passwords must be at least {0} characters long and have {1} or more non-alphanumeric characters.
data.comment: {0} min character length, {1} min non alphanumeric characters

data.name: ReportsConfiguration_SaveGenerated
data.value: I want to save the generated report into the Documents repository

data.name: ReportsConfiguration_SaveGeneratedReportLegend

data.name: ReportsConfiguration_SaveGeneratedReportTitle

data.name: Admin_TaraVaultProjects_Intro
data.value: This page displays a list of all the products that have TaraVault activated:

data.name: Admin_TaraVault_Config_NoProjectsActivated
data.value: No products are activated for TaraVault!

data.name: Admin_CustomPropertyDefinition_DispPositionTooltip
data.value: This is used to sort fields on details pages. Pick a number between 1 to 99 and not one used by another custom property.

data.name: UserDetails_ReportAdminNotes
data.value: Allow the user to adminster custom reports and graphs. They can can create, edit, and delete reports and graphs, and can also access custom report data in 3rd party tools via ODATA

data.name: HierarchicalDocument_RootLink_Tooltip
data.value: Show the root level artifacts only (these are the ones you see when vewing the hierarchical list and showing only "Level 1")

data.name: GeneralSettings_DisableRollupCalculationsNotes
data.value: Setting this to Yes will prevent the system from calculating 'rollup' metrics when data is entered for a product that has its equivalent setting set to Yes. This should not be done unless you have been told by the Onshore Technology Group Support team to do so.

data.name: TestingSettings_DisableRollupCalculationsNotes
data.value: Setting this to Yes will prevent the system from calculating 'rollup' metrics for this product when data is entered in the system (but only if the equivalent system setting is also set to yes). This should not be done unless you have been told by the Onshore Technology Group Support team to do so.

data.name: ChangeMfa_IntroAdd
data.value:
to add two-step authentication to your user account,
please enter the 6-digit one-time password generated by your Authenticator
application when you scan the following QR Code:

data.name: ChangeMfa_IntroChange
data.value:
to change the two-step authentication associated with your user account,
please enter the 6-digit one-time password generated by your Authenticator application
when you scan the following QR Code, or click Remove to disable two-step authentication.

data.name: SecuritySettings_EnableMfa_Notes
data.value: If enabled, users can add a one-time password to their user profile in addition to their primary password for added security.

data.name: UserProfile_MfaSettingsIntro
data.value: Your administrator has activated the use of 2-Step authentication that lets you use a one-time password in addition to your primary password for extra security:
